intro: Phyllanthus discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often spiny stems. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically alternate and ovate in shape. Phyllanthus discolor is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry forests. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
